Novi Sad is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Opportunity Transformation Investments Inc., a holding company owned by charitable organization Opportunity International. The bank is the twenty-third largest bank by total assets in Serbia. It is a universal bank, operating through the network of 26 branches across the country. Opportuntiy Bank a.d. Novi Sad business focus is to service micro clients in rural areas. The business was established in 2002 as Opportunity International Stocks Savings Bank. International Finance Corporation ("IFC") proposed financing of up to EUR 8.5 million, local currency equivalent, is to support the Banks lending portfolio for the purpose of micro and small enterprises lending in local curency.
